Report
Resident
2001 - 2002 Not Recommended Reviewed 05/02/2003
Other than the apartment itself (which was fairly nice and new), there are several major problems with this place: <br><br> <br><br>1. Lack of security--The entrance gate was broken the ENTIRE time we lived here EXCEPT during July-August, when most people are moving in (they want to make a good impression, I guess). Not only is it incredibly shady to only have it working for the sake of show, it does nothing to keep non-residents out of the complex and is specifically stated in the lease not to be an effective security measure. <br><br> <br><br>2. Break-ins--Going along with lack of security, there are extremely high rates of both car and apartment break-ins in this complex. The first week we moved in, our next door neighbor had his computer, TV, and CD player stolen from his living room while he was in the shower. A few months later, there were at least twenty break-ins in our parking lot alone, and my boyfriend´s stereo was stolen TWICE in one month. After the second time, he decided not to replace it or it probably would have happened again. When we complained and asked that a camera be installed in our parking lot, the staff told us that it was not their problem. (We lived in one of the back buildings--#1000--and actually had to pay MORE for the "wooded" view.) <br><br> <br><br>3. Price & Pet Deposit--Everyone in our building paid a different price for their lease, depending on when they moved in. We met people in the laundry room who paid $200 less a month than us for a very similar apartment. In addition, the price we were quoted for a pet deposit ($200--and I made sure to clarify that we had two cats), was actually $200 A PET for a total of $400 when we moved in. <br><br> <br><br>4. The Staff--Even the one staff person that was nice eventually became evil and mean as she gained more power in the office. We also signed our lease with a woman who was -----´s spawn and actually enjoyed being rude and horrible to everyone (every resident that we knew over there hated her, too). The staff constantly lied, saying one thing and actually doing another. The only person that was cool was the maintenance man, and he always did a great job with repairs. <br><br> <br><br>5. Toilet emergency--In April of last year, my roommate´s toilet flooded her entire room, all of the dining room, and half of the living room. Even though we called emergency maintenance, they did not come until the next day and then tried to dry up the nasty sewage water with large fan. When the smell and dampness of this mess got to be too much for us, they finally agreed to replace the carpet in my roommate´s room ONLY and to leave the smelly, ruined carpet in the living room (I must now add that this was a defect with the toilet, not something we did to cause it). When we moved out, they reassured us that we wouldn´t have to pay to replace the rest of the carpet (it wasn´t new at all when we moved in) and that they would just clean it. Well, two weeks later we got a fat bill to replace the carpet, which they have subsequently reported to credit companies as failure to pay. When my boyfriend (who worked for Legal Aid at the time and has many lawyer friends) wrote them a letter from all three of us on the lease demanding that they drop these charges, they just took his name off of the fee and are continually pursuing collection from the toilet-water roommate and myself. <br><br> <br><br>I am not a vengeful person. I generally make the best out of every situation and get along with everyone. BUT, this place is HORRIBLE--do not be wooed by the pretty package they try to sell you!!!! <br><br> <br><br>

I have been happy with my experiance. My apartment is a nice size with a nice view and the location is great! Close to shopping, walking trails etc. The pool is well kept and looks great. Report
Resident
1999 - 2001 Not Recommended Reviewed 04/09/2002
They quoted $100.00 less monthly rent over the phone then what the actual lease stated when we moved in. The apartment was brand new when we moved in. However, SEVERAL PROBLEMS happened. We had to give our sofa away when we move in because it would through the doorway. Water leaked in through the windows in the bedrooms. It was reported several times to the apartment office as a work order without response or when the response did come the problem was not fixed over 2 years of living there. I believe there was a structual problem b/c they applied sealant to the outside of the windows and it did not fix it. We had severe mold around the windows and it made all three of my children severely sick. When I told the apartment manager this, she was not knowledge that mold made people sick. I had to show her documentation from the U.S.E.P.A. to support my claim. We were released from our lease a month early due to the mold causing our children to be sick. One of my sons had been to the doctor 10 times in a 4 month span. He had reactive airway disease from the mold and was hospitalized once. We had several sleepless nights, and missed several days of work and school. This happened over a 2 year period and it took us awhile to realize that the mold on the windows was causing our children to be sick. This was very stressful and was a financial hardship. Our bathtubs continously stopped up and did not drain properly. Dead and live insects were in the apartments most the time, mostly spiders and crickets. The apartment was never exterminated to take care of this problem. Noisy music could be heard occasionally from the neighbor right next to us which meant that the walls were not insulated enough. Security was a problem. Two break-ins happened to our neighbor´s vehicle, a neighbor´s motorcycle was stolen and our motorcycle was stolen. This all happened on different occassions. The rent increase was over $100.00. The grounds were beautiful around the apartment office but not over the whole area. The only part that I did enjoy was the pool. However, that was not without a problem. A swing around the pool fell down when my son was sitting on it. <br>We have since relocated to a high quality apartment for the same price.

Leasing

Southpoint Crossing Apartments in Durham, North Carolina, offers convenient and stylish living in one of the Triangles most exciting areas! Our unrivaled location is less than a mile from The Streets of Southpoint and a quarter mile from I-40. Research Triangle Park is less than 5 miles from our doorstep. NCCU is 5 miles away and both UNC and Duke are less than 8 miles away. We offer spacious 1, 2, and 3 bedroom apartments. Each elegant apartment features a fully-equipped gourmet kitchen with large pantry, washer and dryer connections, spacious closets, and sunny oversized windows. Private patios and pond or wooded views are available as well. Our residents enjoy a variety of resort-style amenities such as a 24/7 fitness center, pool pavilion with sundecks, 24/7 business center, car care center, playground, gazebo with grills, community pond with dazzling fountains, and access to the 23+ mile American Tobacco Trail. Call today to reserve your new home!

Management Company: Greystar*

Office Hours Open Now!

  • Sunday: 01:00 PM - 05:00 PM
  • Monday - Friday: 09:00 AM - 06:00 PM
  • Saturday: 10:00 AM - 05:00 PM
